Sentencas: Ni1-xCdxO-SDC composite materials are prepared and investigated as the hydrogen electrodes for reversible solid oxide cell (RSOC).
Titulo: Performance enhanced of NiCe 0.8 Sm 0.2 O 1.9 hydrogen electrode for reversible solid oxide cells with cadmium substitution

Sentencas: XRD, SEM, XPS and Raman techniques have been used to characterize structural properties, textural and mobility of adsorbed oxygen and lattice oxygen.
Titulo: Performance enhanced of NiCe 0.8 Sm 0.2 O 1.9 hydrogen electrode for reversible solid oxide cells with cadmium substitution

Sentencas: After reduction, Cd is incorporated into the lattice of Ni and formed NiCd alloy.
Titulo: Performance enhanced of NiCe 0.8 Sm 0.2 O 1.9 hydrogen electrode for reversible solid oxide cells with cadmium substitution

Sentencas: The reduced Ni0.9Cd0.1O-SDC possesses the most oxygen vacancies, resulting in the highest catalytic activity for the electrochemical oxidation of H-2 and the electrolysis of H2O.
Titulo: Performance enhanced of NiCe 0.8 Sm 0.2 O 1.9 hydrogen electrode for reversible solid oxide cells with cadmium substitution

Sentencas: The electrochemical oxidation process of H-2 on the hydrogen electrode in solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) mode is investigated with a symmetric cell under various H-2 partial pressures.
Titulo: Performance enhanced of NiCe 0.8 Sm 0.2 O 1.9 hydrogen electrode for reversible solid oxide cells with cadmium substitution

Sentencas: The surface diffusion of adsorbed H atom on the reduced Ni1-xCdxO-SDC composite hydrogen electrodes is the rate-determining step (RDS) for H-2 electrochemical oxidation reaction and the reduced Ni0.9Cd0.1O-SDC shows the highest electrochemical oxidation rates.
Titulo: Performance enhanced of NiCe 0.8 Sm 0.2 O 1.9 hydrogen electrode for reversible solid oxide cells with cadmium substitution

Sentencas: The maximum power densities (P-max) of the cells with reduced Ni0.9Cd0.1O-SDC as hydrogen electrode is 796.2 mW cm(-2) when using H-2 as the fuel at 700 degrees C. Furthermore, in solid oxide electrolysis cell (SOEC) mode, the cell with reduced Ni0.9Cd0.1O-SDC as hydrogen electrode exhibits the best electrolysis performance under various H2O concentrations and the current densities remain stable during the test at different voltages for a total period of 10 h under 47%H2O + 53%H2O atmosphere at 700 degrees C.
Titulo: Performance enhanced of NiCe 0.8 Sm 0.2 O 1.9 hydrogen electrode for reversible solid oxide cells with cadmium substitution
